content.text: We should not display "AGENTS.md" for GitHub Copilot instructions, but instead "Copilot instructions"

content.thinking:
The user wants to change the label displayed for GitHub Copilot instruction files. Currently, files under `.github/instructions/` are showing "AGENTS.md" as their badge/label, but they should show "Copilot instructions" instead.

Let me find where this labeling happens in the codebase.

content.text: Let me find where file type labels are determined in the codebase.

/** Get a badge label for file type */
function getFileTypeBadge(
	fileType?: string,
): { label: string; className: string } | null {
	switch (fileType) {
		case "agents":
			return {
				label: "AGENTS.md",
				className: "bg-indigo-500/20 text-indigo-300",
			};
		case "claude":
			return {
				label: "CLAUDE.md",
				className: "bg-slate-600/40 text-slate-300",
			};
		case "copilot":
			return {
				label: "Copilot",
				className: "bg-slate-600/40 text-slate-300",
			};
		case "rules":
			return {
				label: "Claude Rule",
				className: "bg-slate-600/40 text-slate-300",
			};
		case "cursor-rules":
			return {
				label: "Cursor Rule",
				className: "bg-slate-600/40 text-slate-300",
			};
		case "skills":
			return {
				label: "Skill",
				className: "bg-slate-600/40 text-slate-300",
			};
		case "linked-doc":
			return {

content.text: Now I need to understand where the `fileType` is set. The screenshot shows `.github/instructions/*.md` files getting the "AGENTS.md" badge, meaning they're being classified as `"agents"` type. Let me check the file finder.

content.text:
Found the issue. In `getContextFileType()` at line 72-73, files in `.github/instructions/` that are plain `.md` (not `*.instructions.md`) fall through to the default `return "agents"`. The check on line 65-70 only catches `*.instructions.md` files, but files like `code-style.md`, `react-components.md`, etc. don't match that pattern.

Also, the badge label in `ContextTreeView.tsx` shows "AGENTS.md" for the `"agents"` type, but for copilot files we want "Copilot instructions".

Let me fix both issues:

1. `context-files-summarizer.ts`: Classify plain `.md` files in `.github/instructions/` as `"copilot"`
2. `ContextTreeView.tsx`: Update the copilot badge label to "Copilot instructions"

content.text:
All good. Here's what I changed:

1. **`src/shared/file-system/context-files-summarizer.ts`** (line 64-69): Simplified the `.github/instructions/` check to classify **all** `.md` files in that directory as `"copilot"` type, not just `*.instructions.md` files. Previously, plain `.md` files like `code-style.md` fell through to the default `"agents"` type.

2. **`frontend/src/components/ContextTreeView.tsx`** (line 95): Changed the badge label from `"Copilot"` to `"Copilot instructions"` for the copilot file type.

input.command:
rtk git add frontend/src/components/ContextTreeView.tsx src/shared/file-system/context-files-summarizer.ts && rtk git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Display "Copilot instructions" badge for .github/instructions/ files

Files in .github/instructions/ that don't match *.instructions.md pattern
were falling through to the default "agents" type. Simplified the check to
classify all files in that directory as copilot type, and updated the badge
label from "Copilot" to "Copilot instructions".

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"
